text: Decking type, gauge, and profile match approved shop drawings and submittals
Deck panels free from damage (dents, corrosion, deformation)
Deck panels stored on level supports and protected from weather
Decking installed with ribs facing the correct direction and aligned per drawings
Deck laps and end joints have minimum specified overlap (typically 2”)
Sheets are tightly butted, without gaps or misalignments
Welded deck: Welds are full and continuous at supports and side laps
Screwed deck: Screws driven as per manufacturer spacing/layout
Anchorage to structural steel verified with approved fastener/weld detail
Edge closures, pour stops, and angle supports properly installed and secured
Openings cut only after layout verification and coordination with trades
Reinforcement or edge framing installed around large openings
Temporary bracing and safety measures (fall protection) in place
QA/QC inspection and consultant sign-off before concrete or roofing installation
